positioning.headline: Get your kids to listen without yelling, nagging, or losing control.
positioning.subheadline: The All-In-One Parenting Success SystemÂ® online course gives you the tools you need to finally put an end to exhausting power struggles with your children.
positioning.target_audience: Frustrated parents (toddlers through teens) struggling with behavioral challenges, yelling, power struggles, bedtime/mealtime/homework conflicts, parenting guilt
key_value_props: 37 proven parenting strategies in The Toolbox
Private community support via Facebook group

sections: Hero section with headline, subheadline, and CTA
page_structure.social_proof: 265,000+ happy families across 21 countries | 1.6 million followers | Featured on TODAY Show, NBC, CBS News
page_structure.founder_authority: Amy McCready - parenting expert, author, 14+ years as TODAY Show contributor
trust_signals: Specific, verified testimonials with names and photos

top_keywords.relevance: Directly tied to free trial offer

content_strategy_analysis.homepage_keyword_focus: Heavily focused on course/program discovery keywords rather than behavioral problem-solving. This indicates a conversion-first strategy prioritizing course signups over organic reach through problem-based searches.
keyword_positioning_gap: Ranks #1 for branded 'positive parenting solutions' - strong brand authority
Ranks #3-#6 for course-related terms - good product visibility
Weak presence in behavioral/challenge keywords on homepage (tantrums, behavior, discipline rank on subpages)
Missing opportunity: Could capture more high-volume tantrums (27,100), sibling rivalry (5,400) traffic on homepage
content_strategy_analysis.volume_distribution: Homepage captures only 2.4% of total keyword volume (23,810 / ~1M across domain). Strategy concentrates traffic distribution to subpages, protecting homepage conversion funnel.
content_strategy_analysis.competitor_positioning: Premium course positioning vs. content-first competitors. Homepage doesn't serve as comprehensive resource hub - it's a conversion vehicle.

insights: Homepage optimized for course sales, not SEO reach - only 44 keyword rankings vs. 1000 total domain keywords
Strong brand authority: #1 ranking for branded 'positive parenting solutions' phrase
Course-first positioning: All homepage keywords relate to online learning, not parenting problems
Founder authority heavily leveraged (Amy McCready prominence) - key differentiation vs. generic parenting sites
Large user base (265k+ families) and media mentions (TODAY, NBC, CBS) are primary trust signals, not technical SEO
Missing high-volume behavioral keywords on homepage - tantrums (27,100 vol) and sibling rivalry (5,400 vol) only rank on subpages
Free trial strategy explicitly mentioned (Free Online Class CTA) - lower friction entry vs. paid-only competitors
Community aspect emphasized (Facebook group, live coaching) - differentiator in crowded parenting market
Content organization strategy: homepage drives to course, subpages drive to specific content hubs by topic
